answers.answer: Not sure why the would not do it. I had lasik last year and I had HCV at the time and they knew it.

That's really odd.  I have not only the antibodies, but actual Hep C disease, chronic, over a year; I informed my eye dr & they did the surgery, no problems.  Do you have any other diseases, diabetes, dry eye syndrome, etc. that could've caused them to turn you down?  Also, I heard they don't operate on people whose pupils are too large because they end up with permanent halos/glare/starbursts afterwards.  Did they actually tell you the Hep C disqualified you as a candidate?  If you can, go with a Laser Center affiliated surgeon, they're very good & have a lifetime guarantee (Tiger Woods is their spokesperson; I went through them via my insurance).

They told me something about corneal meltdown could occur.  I think it's bullsh*t.  Everything was okay and I was scheduled for surgery until the doctor went over my charts.  Maybe he is paranoid.  They can't even get an amplitude reading on me for the virus.   I'll go to another doctor.

It only makes sense in the aspect of the interferon doing corneal damage during treatment MAYBE (isn't that why we are tested in advance of treatment and given our baseline numbers?)  maybe he thought this could happen because he heard something of that and just got a bit confused?I would ask him exactly why and explain you aren't even on treatment in a letter - just maybe to save some hassles for the next person.

PS Although I bet there are some doctors out there who wouldn't want to operate on us just BECAUSE - and most of them likely would be in specialty practices I'd think...not in life or death emergency medicine.  Never know some doctors are just in it for the money unfortunately.

I spoke to another lasik surgeon and he said there was a possibility of corneal meltdown contributed by something called moorer's ulceration.  But he said that chance is rare.  Someone who has rheumatoid arthritis is more likely to be affected by this. And it has never occurred with lasik just corneal transplants.  I
Find a new one and don't tell them crapola!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

question: I have hepatitis c antibodies but no viral load.  I recently was turned down for lasik eye surgery because I carried the antibodies.  Has anyone ever heard of this?  And why would having the antibodies affect this kind of surgery?
title: lasik surgery and hep c antibodies
